item.description:
Douglas State Forest with 5,907 acres state borders both Connecticut and Rhode Island.

The Midstate Trail, a long-distance hiking trail that extends through central Massachusetts to Mt. Watatic in the north, runs through the forest.

Douglas State Forest also includes a rare example of Atlantic White Ceder swampland. A 5-acre portion of this swamp is designated as a Massachusetts Wildland. It is accessible to the public via a boardwalk trail.

Please dress in appropriate layers for the weather. Bring plenty of water and snack or lunch for munching along the way. Dogs welcome.

We'll wait 10 minutes. If your running late please call 508-415-0590.

Visit http://www.mass.gov/dcr/parks/central/doug.htm for directions and trail map. Well hike for 2 to 3 hours depending how everyone feels and the weather. Very low temps or heavy snow cancels, please check site before heading out.
item.name: Hike at Douglas State Forest
